details.title: Polls for first phase begins, 1,066 candidates in fray for 71 seats
details.content:
• Of the nearly 2.15 crore electors eligible to exercise the franchise, 1.12 crore are male, 1.01 crore female and 599 are categorised as third gender, according to data provided by the Election Commission.
  • Guidelines have been issued by the Commission for safe conduct of the electoral exercise in the midst of the raging COVID-19 pandemic.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: This is the first time state assembly elections in India are being carried out amid pandemic
details.content:
Voting for the first phase of #BiharElections underway; visuals from polling booth number 155 and 156 in Arrah. pic.twitter.com/6PNyJnzOFo

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: From ruling NDA to Opposition 'Mahagathbandhan', everything you need to know
details.content:
For everyone keen on knowing their Bihar better, here then is our primer on the major alliances.
(READ DETAILS HERE)

details.title: Union Minister Giriraj Singh casts his vote in Phase 1 Bihar election
details.content:
In a tweet, written in Hindi, he said 'first vote, then do other work.'

Bihar: Union Minister Giriraj Singh visited a temple in Barahiya, Lakhisarai.

He says," Election is the biggest festival of democracy. I appeal to everyone to exercise their right to vote." #BiharPolls pic.twitter.com/Xs73MjuBTZ

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: 'Voting first, breakfast later': PM Modi urges citizens to exercise their right to vote
details.content:
I urge all voters to ensure their participation in this festival of democracy while taking precautions against COVI19, tweets PM Narendra Modi in Hindi.

I urge all voters to ensure their participation in this festival of democracy while taking precautions against #COVID19, tweets PM Narendra Modi

Polling for the first phase of #BiharElections is underway. pic.twitter.com/zpnHTA15BF

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

• Polling percentage picks up in first phase of Bihar elections with 4 per cent turnout reported from Patna's five assembly seats so far

(Inputs from ENS)

details.title: WATCH | Will Left parties make a difference in Kanhaiya Kumar's land?

details.content:
• Voting at polling booth no. 170 in Jehanabad delayed after a glitch was detected in EVM

(Inputs from ANI)

• 33 of 71 seats, in the first phase of Bihar elections, have been declared as 'hypersensitive' by Election Commission of India

(Inputs from PTI)

details.title: How Bihar is ensuring a 'safe and secure' election during pandemic
details.content:
The experiences of many countries, including New Zealand, South Korea, Sri Lanka has given the confidence that elections can be held during a pandemic if all protocols in place. But we will know if they can be in India too only once the Bihar polls are over.
(READ DETAILS HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Masks, temperature checks, social distancing made mandatory in polling stations
details.content:
#WATCH: Voters queue up at polling booth number 219 in Aurangabad; polling for the first phase of #BiharElections is underway. pic.twitter.com/CXNoFh3p8v

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: Right to vote is for all, CRPF jawans helping people do just that
details.content:
CRPF jawans helping differently-abled and elderly voters at Booth number 10 in Chakarbandha district

(Photo | ANI)

• Chief electoral officer HR Shrinivas hoped that polling percentage will 'certainly go up' as a lot of safety protocols and arrangements have been made for the voters by poll personnel.

(Inputs from ENS)

details.title: Nitish Kumar’s Lalu barb touches raw nerve as Political propriety goes for a toss
details.content:
It is not the first time that the two leaders have traded barbs at each other. In a free-for-all and no-holds-barred slugfest, Nitish had earlier taken a dig at Tejashwi saying “ask your father or mother if they made any school or college when they had the chance.” But the new statement was a new low given that a veteran like Nitish, known for dignified speeches, made a personal attack against ailing RJD president Lalu Prasad. 
(READ FULL ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: 5 per cent voter turnout recorded till 8.00 am
details.content: (Photo | ANI)

details.title: For justice, employment, vote only for Mahagathbandhan: Rahul Gandhi's message to voters in Bihar
details.content:
• 'This time for justice, employment, farmers-workers, your vote should be only for 'Mahagathbandhan' (grand alliance),' Rahul Gandhi said in a tweet in Hindi.
  • 'Good wishes to all of you on the first phase of Bihar elections," he tweeted with the hashtag in Hindi 'Aaj Badlega Bihar'.

details.title: Chirag Paswan factor to be tested in first phase
details.content:
The Chirag Paswan factor will be tested on Wednesday, as the LJP has fielded candidates on 41 seats of which 35 shall see direct contest with the JD-U in the first phase of the Bihar elections.
(READ DETAILED ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: Voter turnout recorded till 9.00 am
details.content:
Poll Percentage 9 am pic.twitter.com/C76m08Z78T

— CEO Bihar #ElectionDepartmentBihar (@CEOBihar) October 28, 2020

details.title: JP Nadda asks voters to take part in festival of democracy
details.content:
BJP President JP Nadda on Wednesday appealed to voters to participate in this grand festival of democracy while adhering to COVID-19 guidelines. In a tweet, he said the right to cast vote is the biggest strength of democracy.
(READ DETAIL HERE)

details.title: BJP Jamui candidate Shreyasi Singh casts votes
details.content: (Photo | ANI)

details.title: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav rakes up Munger firing on polling day
details.content:
We condemn firing by police in Munger, in which 1 person was killed. This double-engine govt definitely had a role in it. We want to ask Dy CM Sushil Modi, who gave permission to become General Dyer? We want High Court-monitored probe: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Munger incident pic.twitter.com/NlXiajkxwg

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: 'CM is now playing the role of General Dyer': LJP Chief attacks Nitish Kumar on Munger firing incident
details.content: 'Who is responsible for the firing & lathicharge incident in Munger? Chief Minister is now playing the role of General Dyer who ordered the Jallianwalah massacre. I am sure CM is responsible for the incident, an investigation should be done,' said LJP chief Chirag Paswan while talking to reporters during phase 1 of polling.

details.title: Polling agent dies of cardiac arrest, man dies while waiting to vote in Patna
details.content:
The report of the voter's death came from Sasaram and the deceased has been identified as 65-year-old Hira Mahato. He was the resident of  Udaipur and died at polling station number 151 located in a Sanjhaul school where he had come to vote.
(READ FULL ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: At Paligang constituency in Patna, voters follow social distancing
details.content: (Photo | PTI)

details.title: Tejashwi Yadav poses 11 questions to PM Modi ahead of his rally in poll-bound Bihar
details.content:
'PM is coming to Muzaffarpur. Will his combined government in Delhi and Patna speak on the Muzaffarpur shelter home case in which the Chief Minister is providing protection to the accused in the rape of 34 orphan girls?' read one of the questions. 
(READ DETAILED ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: As per ECI rules, every voter to undergo temperature checks before voting
details.content: (Photo | PTI)

details.title: Amid Phase 1 polling, PM Modi addresses rally at Darbhanga
18.31 per cent turnout till 11.00 am, Lakhisarai records highest at 26.28  per cent
details.content:
• The districts that are witnessing higher voter turnout include Lakhisarai with 26.28 per cent and Nawada with 23.87 per cent till 11.20 am
  • Patna with 5.96 per cent along with Bhagalpur with 6.84 per cent has recorded the lowest voter turnout till now.
  • This is the first election that is being held amid COVID-19 pandemic.

(Inputs from Election Commission of India)

details.title: Nitish will ditch BJP to join RJD after poll results: Chirag Paswan attacks Bihar CM again
details.content:
Firing a fresh salvo at Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) chief Chirag Paswan on Wednesday said that he and his party Janata Dal (United) have done preparations to ditch the BJP and join Rashtriya Dal Party (RJD) after the poll results are out.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Technical glitches in 75 EVMs hassle voters in phase 1 polling
details.content:
• Voters waited in queues of over an hour and some even returned home without casting votes as technical snags affected the functioning of over 75 EVMs or VVPATs in Munger, Arwal, Gaya and Nawada districts
  • Voters in Gaya, Jahanabad, Aurangabad, Jamui, Bhabhua, Sasaram, Baka, Kaimur also complained of technical and other errors in EVMs
  • Due to this, polling started late by 30 minutes to 2 hours at several places

(Inputs from IANS)

details.title: FIR Against BJP's Prem Kumar for wearing party symbol mask at polling booth
details.content:
Prem Kumar, who is the sitting MLA from Gaya, had come on a bicycle to cast his vote while wearing a mask with the party's lotus symbol. Officials on poll duty caught the minister in a clear cut violation of the code of conduct. (READ MORE)

(Photo | ANI)

details.title: As Bihar votes, Shashi Tharoor reminds voters of migrant crisis during COVID-19 lockdown
details.content: 'The tears in your eyes, the blisters on your feet. Do you remember everything? The ones who are voting today,' senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor wrote on Twitter in Hindi.

details.title: Those who used to taunt us now forced to clap: Modi rakes up Ayodhya, 'jungle raj' at Bihar rally
details.content:
Noting that voting was underway in several assembly segments in the first phase of elections, Modi urged the people to stay safe and take precautions in view of the COVID 19 pandemic while exercising their franchise.
(READ DETAILED ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: While people exercised their right to vote, not all were seen wearing masks
details.content: Voters show their fingers marked with indelible ink at a polling station after casting their votes for the first phase Bihar Assembly Elections, at Naubatpur in Patna. (Photo | PTI)

details.title: Here is why Balgudar villagers in Lakhisarai district boycotted elections
details.content:
Bihar Minister and BJP candidate Kumar Sinha said that that good governance is visible but the atmosphere of boycott that has been created in some places is "sponsored".
(READ DETAILED ARTICLE HERE)

details.title: Bihar records 33.10% turnout till 1 PM
details.content:
As per the provisional voter turnout data updated by the Election Commission at 1 PM, 33.10 per cent of the total electorates have exercised their franchise.

The maximum 40.16 per cent turnout has been recorded in Lakhisarai, followed by Nawada (38.08%) and Patna, Jamui and Bhagalpur (over 34 per cent). (READ MORE)

details.title: WATCH | On voting day, Mahagathbandhan 'condemns' Munger police firing incident
Tejashwi Yadav 'yuvraj' of 'jungle raj', says PM Modi at rally
details.content: Addressing his second rally of the day, Modi cautioned the people that a return of the "jungle raj" will bring a double whammy for the state in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. (READ MORE)

details.title: Former Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi votes
details.content:
Bihar: Former CM Jitan Ram Manjhi casts his vote at a polling booth in Gaya during the first phase of state assembly elections.

"Out of 71 seats in phase-1, NDA will comfortably win around 50 seats," he said. pic.twitter.com/xESfOf6Oqu

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: Demonetisation, lockdown aimed at destroying small farmers, business: Rahul Gandhi
details.content: The motive of demonetisation & lockdown was the same. It was aimed at destroying small farmers, small businesses, traders and labourers, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in a rally at Balmiki Nagar, Bihar.

details.title: PM Modi doesn't talk about giving jobs to youth now: Rahul Gandhi
details.content:
Addressing his rally at Valmiki Nagar, the former Congress president said the prime minister and the Bihar chief minister used to raise the issue of unemployment earlier but no longer now.

"Now, the PM does not say in his speeches that he would give two crore jobs. Because the people of Bihar have realised that he had lied. I can guarantee that if the PM comes today and promises two crore jobs to youths, perhaps the crowd would shoo him off, telling him that he had lied," Gandhi said. (READ MORE)

details.title: BJP files complaint against Rahul Gandhi over his tweet
details.content:
Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) files complaint to Election Commission (EC) against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his tweet posted today asking for votes in the first phase of #BiharElections from voters today. pic.twitter.com/5XUg8NHAFG

— ANI (@ANI) October 28, 2020

details.title: Single vote you can save Bihar from becoming 'bimar': PM Modi at Patna
details.content:
"Just like you can save your self from COVID-19 with a mask, similarly with a single vote you can save Bihar from becoming 'bimar'," said PM Modi while addressing a public rally in Patna.

Quotes from PM's speech:

  • Due to the efforts of the NDA government, Bihar has come a long way from inconvenience to convenience, from darkness to light, from distrust to trust, from kidnapping of industries to opportunities
  • If there was no 'Trishakti' of Jan Dhan, aadhaar and mobile, then in the corona period, the ration rights of poor people of Bihar would have been usurped, like previous years

(ANI inputs)

details.title: WATCH | At 3pm voter turnout at 46%, covid norm violated at booths
details.content: The voter turnout in Bihar Assembly elections is at 46.29 per cent with highest polling recorded at Ramgarh constituency with over 56 per cent voting.

details.title: Only NDA can fulfil aspirations of poor, middle class in Bihar: PM Modi at Gaya rally
details.content:
The Prime Minister said that Atal Bihari Vajpayee used to say that the definition of electricity in Bihar is that the connection here is mostly out of the place. The darkness of the lantern period has now ended in the state, he added.

"Who can fulfill the aspirations of the poor and middle class of Bihar? Can those who looted Bihar do it? Those who only thought of their families and did injustice to everyone can never understand Bihar's expectations. Only NDA can do it," said PM Modi.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi addresses rally in Darbhanga
details.content:
LIVE : ???? @RahulGandhi ?? ?????, ??????. #????????????? https://t.co/gpynK0Tdlx

— INCBihar (@INCBihar) October 28, 2020

details.title: If you want to dream, go to other parts of India, says Rahul Gandhi
details.content: If you want to dream, go to other parts of India. If you want work, you've to go to Mumbai. And once you goto Mumbai, Punjab and one day Modi will come on tv and say Rs500, Rs 1000 notes are not fine and I will ban it. You all remember standing outside bank right?: Rahul Gandhi at Darbhanga rally

details.title: Small shopkeepers, youths, farmers angry with PM Modi, CM Nitish: Rahul Gandhi
details.content:
Congress leader Rahul Gandhi Wednesday said there was anger among small shopkeepers, youths, farmers and labourers against Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the national level and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar in Bihar.

He said the people of Bihar gave 15 years to Nitish Kumar as chief minister and six years to Modi as Prime Minister yet "Bihar is the poorest state". (READ MORE)

details.title: PM Modi will make Bihar 'developed' state if NDA voted to power: CM Nitish in rally
details.content:
Lavishing praise on Modi, Kumar referred to a slew of projects to assert that the people of Bihar can never forget what he has done for the state.

"Listening to his (Modi's) appeal, if you give the NDA one more chance to work in the state, then you take it for sure that he will transform it into a developed state. Bihar with march ahead," he said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Voter turnout at 5 pm
details.content: The voter turnout in Bihar Assembly elections is at 51.91 per cent with highest polling recorded at Jamui with over 57 per cent polling at 5 pm.

details.title: I want to thank Bihar voters: Chief Election Commissioner
details.content:
The Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora on Wednesday thanked the voters for turning up under such dire situation during the first phase of Bihar Assembly elections.

Excerpts from the ECI press meet:

  • Despite the pandemic, the voter turnout is projected to be more than the last Assembly elctions and Lok Sabha elections in Bihar.
  • Stray incidents of EVM snags have been sorted at minimum possible time.
  • 85,368  people used the option of postal voting which was providied to citizens above the age of 80 and specially-abled people.

Poll Percentage 6 pm pic.twitter.com/hLxSHbBn48
